src:
Alarm Pembajakan Tak Sengaja Tertekan, Bandara Schiphol Heboh
07 Nov 2019, 10:35 by Johanes Randy Prakoso


Keramaian di Bandara Schiphol pasca alarm pembajakan berbunyi (Mark Crompton/Istimewa)

Amsterdam - Kehebohan sempat terjadi di Bandara Schiphol, Belanda, hari Rabu kemarin (6/11). Setelah diusut, ternyata karena alarm pembajakan tertekan.Hal itu pun diketahui lewat banyaknya unggahan foto yang menggambarkan keriuhan di bandara utama Amsterdam tersebut di dunia maya. Dilansir detikcom dari CNN, Kamis (7/11/2019), sejumlah saksi mata bahkan melaporkan terjadinya penutupan sejumlah bagian bandara saat itu.Mengetahui adanya alarm tersebut, pihak Kepolisian Khusus Belanda dan aparat lainnya langsung bergegas menuju Bandara Schiphol dan mengecek situasi.Keriuhan itu pun diketahui berlangsung selama satu jam dan cair setelah pihak kepolisian melakukan pengumuman bahwa semua penumpang dan kru pesawat baik-baik saja.Pihak maskapai Air Europa pun berujar lewat kicauannya di Twitter, menginformasikan kalau kehebohan itu terjadi akibat alarm pembajakan yang tak sengaja berbunyi akibat kesalahan.



"Alarm pembajakan yang berbunyi membuat protokol bertindak, tapi tak ada yang terjadi. Semua penumpang baik-baik saja dan menunggu terbang. Kami benar-benar minta maaf atas gangguan yang terjadi," ujar Air Europa.Bandara Schiphol di Belanda diketahui sebagai bandara tersibuk ketiga di dunia setelah Bandara Heathrow dan Charles de Gaulle di Paris. Sekitar 6,5 juta orang datang ke bandara tersebut seperti diberitakan di situs resminya. Simak Video "Asyik! Sebentar Lagi KA Bandara Adi Soemarmo-Boyolali Bisa Dinikmati"[Gambas:Video 20detik](rdy/rdy)
text:
Accidental Depression Piracy Alarm, Schiphol Heboh Airport
Nov 7 2019, 10:35 by Johanes Randy Prakoso


Crowds at Schiphol Airport after the piracy alarm goes off (Mark Crompton / Special)

Amsterdam - The excitement had occurred at Schiphol Airport, the Netherlands, last Wednesday (6/11). After being investigated, it turned out that because of piracy alarms depressed. It was also known through the many upload photos that illustrate the hubbub at the Amsterdam main airport in cyberspace. Reported by AFP from CNN, Thursday (11/07/2019), a number of eyewitnesses even reported the closure of a number of parts of the airport at the time. Knowing of the alarm, the Dutch Special Police and other officials immediately rushed to Schiphol Airport and checked the situation. also known to last for an hour and liquid after the police announced that all passengers and crew were fine. The airline Air Europa also said through Twitter on Twitter, informing that the furor was caused by an alarm hijacking that accidentally sounded due to an error.



"A hijacking alarm that makes the protocol act, but nothing happens. All passengers are fine and waiting to fly. We are really sorry for the disruption," said Air Europa. Schiphol Airport in the Netherlands is known as the third busiest airport in the world after Heathrow Airport and Charles de Gaulle in Paris. Around 6.5 million people came to the airport as reported on the official website. Check out the video "Fun! Soon the Adi Soemarmo-Boyolali Airport Railway Can Be Enjoyed" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (rdy / rdy)
